name: Integrative Studies in Arts and Humanities

IAH201.name: United States and the World (D)
IAH201.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
IAH201.description: Major issues in development of U.S. society and culture, presented in international and comparative context. Influences from native Americans, Europeans, Africans, and Asians. Organized historically, with thematic emphasis on literature and the arts.
IAH201.prerequisite: Completion of Tier I Writing Requirement

IAH202.name: Europe and the World (I)
IAH202.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
IAH202.description: Cultural encounters and political relationships between Europeans and people(s) from other regions of the world since 1500 as shown through study of written texts, literature, the visual arts, music, and other forms of expression. Examples from Europe and several continents.
IAH202.prerequisite: Completion of Tier I Writing Requirement

IAH203.name: Latin America and the World (I)
IAH203.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
IAH203.description: Major issues in the development of Latin American societies and cultures, presented in global perspective. Influences from indigenous peoples, Europeans, Africans, and others. Organized thematically and historically, through study of written texts, literature, and the arts.
IAH203.prerequisite: Completion of Tier I Writing Requirement

IAH204.name: Asia and the World (I)
IAH204.description: Major issues in the development of Asian societies and cultures and their interaction with other regions of the world since 1600. Topics from East, Southeast, and South Asia. Organized thematically and historically, through study of written texts, the arts, and other forms of expression.
IAH204.prerequisite: Completion of Tier I Writing Requirement

IAH205.name: Africa and the World (I)
IAH205.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
IAH205.description: Major issues in the development of African societies and their interaction with other regions of the world since 600 through study of written texts, the arts and other forms of expression. Topics from West, East, North, and Southern Africa. Organized thematically and historically.
IAH205.prerequisite: Completion of Tier I Writing Requirement

IAH206.name: Self, Society, and Technology (D)
IAH206.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
IAH206.description: Exploration in how technology affects and is affected by our conceptions of ourselves, relations with others, and our ideals. Approaches and materials from philosophy, literature, art, music, and history as well as the natural sciences.
IAH206.prerequisite: Completion of Tier I writing requirement.

IAH207.name: Literatures, Cultures, Identities (I)
IAH207.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
IAH207.description: Explorations in how literature reflects, creates, and challenges cultural and individual identities. Approaches and materials from literature, philosophy, the arts, religion, and history. Selected themes and issues, variable by term.
IAH207.prerequisite: Completion of Tier I Writing Requirement

IAH208.name: Music and Culture (I)
IAH208.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
IAH208.description: Relationships between music and culture. Organized historically, geographically, or thematically, through study of written texts, music, the visual arts, and other forms of expression. Selected topics, variable by term in content and approach.
IAH208.prerequisite: Completion of Tier I Writing Requirement

IAH209.name: Art, the Visual, and Culture (D)
IAH209.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
IAH209.description: Exploration of art and visual culture in historical and cultural contexts. Reading and analysis of images. Approaches and materials from art history, anthropology, history, literature, philosophy, religious studies, economics, and natural science in cross-cultural and international perspective. Content variable by term.
IAH209.prerequisite: Completion of Tier I Writing Requirement

IAH210.name: Middle East and the World (I)
IAH210.description: Major issues in the development of Middle Eastern societies and cultures, presented in global perspective. Influences from European, Africans, Asians, and others. Organized thematically and historically, though study of written texts, literature, and the arts.
IAH210.prerequisite: Completion of Tier I Writing Requirement

IAH211A.name: Area Studies and Multicultural Civilizations: Africa (I)
IAH211A.prerequisite: (IAH 201 or IAH 202 or IAH 203 or IAH 204 or IAH 205 or IAH 206 or IAH 207 or IAH 208 or IAH 209 or IAH 210) or (RCAH 202 and completion of Tier I writing requirement) or (AL 210 and completion of Tier I writing requirement) or (AL 110 and AL 210)

IAH211B.name: Area Studies and Multicultural Civilizations: Asia (I)
IAH211B.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
IAH211B.prerequisite: (IAH 201 or IAH 202 or IAH 203 or IAH 204 or IAH 205 or IAH 206 or IAH 207 or IAH 208 or IAH 209 or IAH 210) or (RCAH 202 and completion of Tier I writing requirement) or (AL 210 and completion of Tier I writing requirement) or (AL 110 and AL 210)

IAH211C.name: Area Studies and Multicultural Civilizations: The Americas (D)
IAH211C.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
IAH211C.description: Arts and humanities of the Americas
IAH211C.prerequisite: (IAH 201 or IAH 202 or IAH 203 or IAH 204 or IAH 205 or IAH 206 or IAH 207 or IAH 208 or IAH 209 or IAH 210) or (RCAH 202 and completion of Tier I writing requirement) or (AL 210 and completion of Tier I writing requirement) or (AL 110 and AL 210)

IAH211D.name: Area Studies and Multicultural Civilizations: The Middle East (I)
IAH211D.description: Arts and humanities of the Middle East
IAH211D.prerequisite: (IAH 201 or IAH 202 or IAH 203 or IAH 204 or IAH 205 or IAH 206 or IAH 207 or IAH 208 or IAH 209 or IAH 210) or (RCAH 202 and completion of Tier I writing requirement) or (AL 210 and completion of Tier I writing requirement) or (AL 110 and AL 210)

IAH221A.name: Great Ages: The Ancient World (I)
IAH221A.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
IAH221A.description: Arts and humanities of the ancient world examined through the frame of urban and intellectual life. Literature, visual arts, music, religion and philosophy presented in historical context. Selected regions and themes. Variable by term.
IAH221A.prerequisite: (IAH 201 or IAH 202 or IAH 203 or IAH 204 or IAH 205 or IAH 206 or IAH 207 or IAH 208 or IAH 209 or IAH 210) or (RCAH 202 and completion of Tier I writing requirement) or (AL 210 and completion of Tier I writing requirement) or (AL 110 and AL 210)

IAH221B.name: Great Ages: The Medieval and Early Modern Worlds (I)
IAH221B.description: Arts and humanities of the medieval and early modern worlds
IAH221B.prerequisite: (IAH 201 or IAH 202 or IAH 203 or IAH 204 or IAH 205 or IAH 206 or IAH 207 or IAH 208 or IAH 209 or IAH 210) or (RCAH 202 and completion of Tier I writing requirement) or (AL 210 and completion of Tier I writing requirement) or (AL 110 and AL 210)

IAH221C.name: Great Ages: The Modern World (I)
IAH221C.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
IAH221C.description: Arts and humanities of the modern world, examined through the frame of urban and intellectual life. Literature, visual arts, music, religion and philosophy presented in historical context. Selected regions and themes. Variable by term.
IAH221C.prerequisite: (IAH 201 or IAH 202 or IAH 203 or IAH 204 or IAH 205 or IAH 206 or IAH 207 or IAH 208 or IAH 209 or IAH 210) or (RCAH 202 and completion of Tier I writing requirement) or (AL 210 and completion of Tier I writing requirement) or (AL 110 and AL 210)

IAH231A.name: Themes and Issues: Human Values and the Arts and Humanities (D)
IAH231A.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
IAH231A.description: Values of individualism, responsibility, love, community, and rationality. Students are introduced to diverse methods and materials from the arts and humanities.
IAH231A.prerequisite: (IAH 201 or IAH 202 or IAH 203 or IAH 204 or IAH 205 or IAH 206 or IAH 207 or IAH 208 or IAH 209 or IAH 210) or (RCAH 202 and completion of Tier I writing requirement) or (AL 210 and completion of Tier I writing requirement) or (AL 110 and AL 210)

IAH231B.name: Themes and Issues: Moral Issues and the Arts and Humanities (D)
IAH231B.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
IAH231B.description: Human conflict and moral dilemmas, addressed through diverse methods and materials from the arts and humanities.
IAH231B.prerequisite: (IAH 201 or IAH 202 or IAH 203 or IAH 204 or IAH 205 or IAH 206 or IAH 207 or IAH 208 or IAH 209 or IAH 210) or (RCAH 202 and completion of Tier I writing requirement) or (AL 210 and completion of Tier I writing requirement) or (AL 110 and AL 210)

IAH231C.name: Themes and Issues: Roles of Language in Society (D)
IAH231C.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
IAH231C.description: Language as the medium of culture in various societies. Power and social identity as manifested through language. Students are introduced to diverse methods and materials from the arts and humanities.
IAH231C.prerequisite: (IAH 201 or IAH 202 or IAH 203 or IAH 204 or IAH 205 or IAH 206 or IAH 207 or IAH 208 or IAH 209 or IAH 210) or (RCAH 202 and completion of Tier I writing requirement) or (AL 210 and completion of Tier I writing requirement) or (AL 110 and AL 210)

IAH241A.name: Creative Arts and Humanities: Music and Society in the Modern World (D)
IAH241A.description: The arts and humanities of the modern world through the prism of music. Music traditions and methodologies in their historic context. Relationship of music creativity to societies in which it has been produced.
IAH241A.prerequisite: (IAH 201 or IAH 202 or IAH 203 or IAH 204 or IAH 205 or IAH 206 or IAH 207 or IAH 208 or IAH 209 or IAH 210) or (RCAH 202 and completion of Tier I writing requirement) or (AL 210 and completion of Tier I writing requirement) or (AL 110 and AL 210)

IAH241B.name: Creative Arts and Humanities: Philosophy in Literature (D)
IAH241B.description: Philosophy and literature, relationships to each other and to societies in which they were produced. Themes such as the meaning of life, God and the problem of evil, and the nature of knowledge. Authors such as Voltaire, Dostoevsky, Wright, and Atwood examined from a variety of perspectives.
IAH241B.prerequisite: (IAH 201 or IAH 202 or IAH 203 or IAH 204 or IAH 205 or IAH 206 or IAH 207 or IAH 208 or IAH 209 or IAH 210) or (RCAH 202 and completion of Tier I writing requirement) or (AL 210 and completion of Tier I writing requirement) or (AL 110 and AL 210)

IAH241C.name: Creative Arts and Humanities: Cultural and Artistic Traditions of Europe (I)
IAH241C.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
IAH241C.description: European artistic and cultural movements and styles, introduced through works of art, music, literature, philosophy, and religion. Presented in historical context. Specific eras and works variable by term.
IAH241C.prerequisite: (IAH 201 or IAH 202 or IAH 203 or IAH 204 or IAH 205 or IAH 206 or IAH 207 or IAH 208 or IAH 209 or IAH 210) or (RCAH 202 and completion of Tier I writing requirement) or (AL 210 and completion of Tier I writing requirement) or (AL 110 and AL 210)

IAH241D.name: Creative Arts and Humanities: Theater and Society in the West (I)
IAH241D.description: Artistic creativity seen through the prism of theater, presented in historical context. Influences from art, literature, music, and religion. Focus on translation of social visions into dramatic art. Plays and themes variable by term.
IAH241D.prerequisite: (IAH 201 or IAH 202 or IAH 203 or IAH 204 or IAH 205 or IAH 206 or IAH 207 or IAH 208 or IAH 209 or IAH 210) or (RCAH 202 and completion of Tier I writing requirement) or (AL 210 and completion of Tier I writing requirement) or (AL 110 and AL 210)

IAH241E.name: Creative Arts and Humanities: The Creative Process (D)
IAH241E.description: Philosophical, religious and historical foundations for understanding the process of creation in visual arts, theatre, music, and literature. Variations across eras and societies.
IAH241E.prerequisite: (IAH 201 or IAH 202 or IAH 203 or IAH 204 or IAH 205 or IAH 206 or IAH 207 or IAH 208 or IAH 209 or IAH 210) or (RCAH 202 and completion of Tier I writing requirement) or (AL 210 and completion of Tier I writing requirement) or (AL 110 and AL 210)

IAH241F.name: Creative Arts and Humanities: Traditions in World Art (I)
IAH241F.description: Aesthetic qualities of painting, sculpture, and architecture within historical contexts across major civilizations. Visual forms in relation to belief systems and musical and literary traditions.
IAH241F.prerequisite: (IAH 201 or IAH 202 or IAH 203 or IAH 204 or IAH 205 or IAH 206 or IAH 207 or IAH 208 or IAH 209 or IAH 210) or (RCAH 202 and completion of Tier I writing requirement) or (AL 210 and completion of Tier I writing requirement) or (AL 110 and AL 210)

IAH241G.name: Creative Arts and Humanities: Film and Culture (D)
IAH241G.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
IAH241G.description: The arts and humanities through the prism of film. Integration of perspectives from literature, visual arts, music, religion, philosophy. Introduction to diverse methods and materials from the arts and humanities for thinking about film and how it engages various perspectives from around the world. Selected themes. Variable by term.
IAH241G.prerequisite: (IAH 201 or IAH 202 or IAH 203 or IAH 204 or IAH 205 or IAH 206 or IAH 207 or IAH 208 or IAH 209 or IAH 210) or (RCAH 202 and completion of Tier I writing requirement) or (AL 210 and completion of Tier I writing requirement) or (AL 110 and AL 210)
